translation.en: [woman] Here I am, 22 years old,
being whisked away with the man I love,
with three million dollars.
It is a fantasy dream that was a reality back in 1993.
translation.ko: 그건 1993년 당시만 해도 현실이었던 환상적 꿈이에요

translation.en: Holy cow.
[newswoman 1] Everyone who comes to Vegas hopes to score that elusive jackpot.
translation.ko: 베이거스에 오는 사람들은 모두 이런 잭팟을 노리죠

translation.en: [newsman 1] Heather Tallchief appears to have gotten away with what some may call the perfect crime.
translation.ko: 헤더 톨치프는 완전 범죄에 성공한 것으로 보입니다

translation.en: [newswoman 1] Heather Catherine Tallchief vanished on Friday
translation.ko: 헤더 캐서린 톨치프는 금요일에 루미스 현금 수송차와 함께 사라졌죠

translation.en: along with the Loomis armored van.
translation.ko: 금요일에 루미스 현금 수송차와 함께 사라졌죠

translation.en: [newsman 2] In Las Vegas today, a suspect in one of the most infamous armored car heists
translation.ko: 라스베이거스에서 가장 악명 높은 현금 수송차 강탈 사건의 용의자는

translation.en: remains on the run.
[newswoman 2] No one has seen her, the truck, or the money since Friday.
translation.ko: 금요일 이후로 헤더, 수송차나 돈을 본 사람은 없습니다

translation.en: [newsman 3] This beautiful young woman got away with millions.
translation.ko: 이 아름다운 젊은 여성은 수백만 달러를 들고 도망쳤습니다

translation.en: [newsman 4] A 21-year-old pulling off a multimillion-dollar caper?
translation.ko: 수백만 달러가 얽힌 범죄 행각을 21살짜리가 벌였다고요?

translation.en: No one could believe it.
[newsman 5] The armored truck was packed
with more than three million dollars in cash.
An absolutely incredible real-life crime story
straight out of a Hollywood script.
[newsman 6] A story of sex, magick, money, murder.
One of the biggest heists in Las Vegas history.
This is a love story at heart.
The prince who took the princess and, against all odds,
translation.ko: 왕자가 공주를 데리고 모든 역경을 이겨낸 뒤

translation.en: whisked her away on this wild ride into the sunset.
translation.ko: 함께 떠나서 행복한 결말을 맞은 거죠

translation.en: We're in a bar, and this guy came up to me and asked,
"Can I buy you a drink or something?"
"Yeah, okay."
Because I didn't have a single dollar to my name,
I kid you not.
And he just… He was just flirtatious and full of charisma.
translation.ko: 대놓고 저한테 집적대는데 카리스마가 장난 아니었어요

translation.en: He asked me something weird.
Something like, "Do you believe in the devil?"
And I'm like, "Well… that depends on whether or not one considers that there's a God."
translation.ko: 전 대답했어요, '그건 신이 있다고 믿는지 여부에 달렸죠'

translation.en: Ask me a dumb question, I'm gonna give you a dumb answer back.
translation.ko: 바보 같은 질문에는 바보 같은 대답을 하는 거예요

translation.en: Yet I was kind of chuckling, 'cause that's not the usual pick-up line.
translation.ko: 하지만 웃음이 킥킥 나왔죠 일반적인 작업 멘트가 아니니까요

translation.en: So, I was like, "Okay, this will be interesting."
"I'm gonna engage here on this one."
So, he says, "Do you wanna go do a line?"
And I'm like, "Well, yeah."
I was like… "What is all this?"
He was really into a lot of eclectic mysticism,
pagan-type thoughts, sex magick.
And he's like, "This is my little altar where I do a lot of goddess worship."
translation.ko: 여기가 여신을 숭배하는 작은 제단이라고 하더군요

translation.en: Well, he would write poetry, and I remember him reading quite a bit.
translation.ko: 시도 썼어요 책도 상당히 많이 읽더군요

translation.en: It was pretty dope.
[Solis on recording] The love of a woman stumbles drunk into my tavern,
translation.ko: 한 여자의 사랑이 술에 취해 비틀거리며 내 선술집으로 오네

translation.en: and I break the law, serving it wine.
And I chance disaster…
[Heather] The headspace I was in at the time I met Solis
translation.ko: 솔리스를 만날 당시 제 정신 상태는 혼란스러웠고

translation.en: was very disjointed, very disconnected, very disillusional.
translation.ko: 솔리스를 만날 당시 제 정신 상태는 혼란스러웠고 일관성이 없었으며 환멸을 느끼고 있었어요

translation.en: [Solis] …and surrender to, guilty of everything.
[Heather] I was a certified nurse's assistant.
The majority of the people that I took care of had full-blown AIDS.
translation.ko: 에이즈가 완전히 진행된 환자들을 주로 돌봤죠

translation.en: Young, twenty-year-olds.
You get attached to these folks.
I remember being in the room when someone passed away.
translation.ko: 한 환자가 사망할 때 병실에 함께 있었던 적이 있어요

translation.en: It's the most profound thing you'll ever feel.
translation.ko: 그렇게 심오한 감정은 평생 느낄 수 없겠죠

translation.en: I just wanted to escape.
A girl at work introduced crack cocaine.
It was a very, very quick downward spiral.
I lost my job, was going nowhere.
So, when I discovered all of these metaphysical concepts,
translation.ko: 그러다가 이런 각종 형이상학적 개념을 만나니

translation.en: it made me feel like I'm not floating out here in the ether.
translation.ko: 개인적, 사회적 목표로부터 혼자 떨어진 느낌이 사라졌어요

translation.en: It was a feeling of discovery,
and finding something about yourself that was never really apparent before.
translation.ko: 전에는 흐릿하기만 했던 내면을 찾아낸 것 같았죠

translation.en: [Solis] The poetry I write brings out a warrior consciousness.
translation.ko: 내가 쓰는 시는 전사의 의식을 불러일으킨다

translation.en: We emerge as the living, the strong, the willing.
translation.ko: 우리는 살아 있고 강력한 의지로 부흥한다

translation.en: [Heather] He was the stillness in the eye of the storm.
translation.ko: 그 사람은 폭풍의 눈에 있는 정적이었어요

translation.en: He gave a sense of purpose…
direction, security.
I ended up moving in with him not long after that.
translation.ko: 얼마 지나지 않아 함께 살게 됐어요

translation.en: He made me feel like a queen.
I'm talking flowers, white doves, petals on the floor.
translation.ko: 꽃이며, 흰 비둘기며 바닥에 뿌려진 장미 꽃잎이며

translation.en: The kind of Romeo that's cliché and kind of like, "Oh, please."
translation.ko: 진부한 로미오같이 보여서 거부하고 싶을 만도 하지만

translation.en: But yet the female part of me loves that.
It was easy, it was comforting.
It was very safe.
However I define love, he was that definition.
translation.ko: 사랑을 어떻게 정의하든 간에 그가 사랑이었어요

translation.en: [Heather] I wasn't naive to the fact that he was a career criminal.
translation.ko: 그가 전문 범죄자라는 사실을 모르는 것도 아니었죠

translation.en: He was already an outlaw when I met him.
Chaos is exciting. Chaos is sexy.
One night he calls me up and he's like, "I need you to be ready to go."
translation.ko: 어느 날 밤, 전화해서 이래요 '떠날 준비해'

translation.en: And I'm like, "Go where?"
And he's just, "Be ready to go, bring clothes."
So we go to the back of this mall, and my job is to sit in the car with the key
translation.ko: 어떤 쇼핑몰 뒷문으로 가요 제 일은 시동 걸고 안에 탄 채 차를 지키는 거였어요

translation.en: and make sure nothing happens to the car.
translation.ko: 제 일은 시동 걸고 안에 탄 채 차를 지키는 거였어요

translation.en: Meanwhile, he conducted a robbery.
I remember him breaking into the lockbox,
and there was something like 30 grand in this box.
And a very nice gold Rolex.
And I was like,
"Oh, that's nice. Let me wear that."
"What are you doing?"
He's like, "This'll get you in trouble. This is identifiable."
translation.ko: 그러더군요, '그러다 문제 생겨 저건 눈에 띈다고'

translation.en: Las Vegas was where he was gonna hit.
It was an opportunity to try a new path.
We were gonna hit big.
Well, here's a man who was really keen on accumulating wealth,
translation.ko: 이 남자는 부를 축적하는 데 굉장히 열심이었지만

translation.en: but not in any kind of traditional way.
He was always trying to hit big by doing something totally off the wall.
translation.ko: 언제나 한탕을 노렸죠 완전히 별난 방식으로요

translation.en: Selling a boat, selling art, playing craps.
Working hard, clocking in, clocking out, was not an option.
translation.ko: 제대로 출퇴근을 하며 열심히 일할 생각은 없었어요

translation.en: "Why don't we just get jobs?"
He's like, "You're a fool if you think that's gonna happen that way."
translation.ko: 이렇게 말하곤 했죠 '그렇게 하면 부자 절대로 안 돼'

translation.en: I just got absorbed in this whole feeling of security,
translation.ko: 그 사람이 내뿜는 안정감에 저는 완전히 푹 빠졌죠

translation.en: and this warmth.
"Somebody's really invested in me." Never really experienced that before.
translation.ko: '누군가 내게 마음을 쏟고 있어' 그런 경험은 처음이었죠

translation.en: I was born Kensington-Bailey area of Buffalo.
translation.ko: 난 버펄로의 켄싱턴 베일리 지역에서 태어났죠

translation.en: Our house was a big, beautiful house on the corner of Comstock and Amherst,
translation.ko: "1978년" 콤스톡과 애머스트 교차로에 크고 아름다운 우리 집이 있었어요

translation.en: and it was the spot.
Dad was "The Dude."
[Fred] Let me tell you something.
We were smoking weed one day, and were putting, uh, formaldehyde on it.
translation.ko: 하루는 대마초를 피우면서 포름알데히드를 위에 발랐어요

translation.en: It's like doing horse tranquilizer.
You put it on the weed and it just like… I was giving it to heroin addicts
translation.ko: 어쨌든 대마에 바르고 헤로인 중독자들한테 줬어요

translation.en: and they were just freaking out, like, "This stuff's bad." You know?
You don't smoke formaldehyde, you know? You don't put that shit in your system.
translation.ko: 포름알데히드를 피우는 사람은 없어요 그런 걸 폐에 넣진 않죠 시체에나 바르는 거니까요

translation.en: That's what they do to dead bodies, you know?
translation.ko: 그런 걸 폐에 넣진 않죠 시체에나 바르는 거니까요

translation.en: But I wanted to get high at all costs.
translation.ko: 하지만 어떻게 해서든 약에 취하고 싶었어요

translation.en: A lot of people would just hang out on the front stoop drinking.
translation.ko: 현관 입구 계단에는 늘 많은 이가 술을 마시고 있었죠

translation.en: I remember being little and the police coming on different occasions.
translation.ko: 어릴 땐 여러 가지 일로 경찰이 집에 들락거렸어요

translation.en: Fights, there was always some kind of domestic fight.
translation.ko: 싸움도 잦았죠 언제나 가정 폭력이 발생했어요

translation.en: [Titus] I remember coming, like next morning, waking up,
coming downstairs, there might be bodies laying around.
People passed out on the floor, on a couch, on a chair,
translation.ko: 사람들이 바닥, 소파, 의자에 쓰러져 있었죠

translation.en: on the kitchen floor.
And just trying to find out which one's my mom, which one's my dad.
translation.ko: 그저 엄마랑 아빠만 찾아다니던 기억이 나요

translation.en: "I think I gotta go to school."
[Heather] My mother and father had me while they were still in high school.
translation.ko: 엄마와 아빠는 고등학생 시절 날 가졌어요

translation.en: [Fred] We had sex, but it was just a mistake, and then we had… she got pregnant.
translation.ko: 섹스를 하긴 했지만 실수였는데 갑자기 임신하더군요

translation.en: I didn't know anything. I didn't know a girl got pregnant, nobody told me they got pregnant.
translation.ko: 여자들이 임신할 수 있단 거 몰랐어요, 들은 적 없었으니까

translation.en: "What do you mean you're pregnant? When did this happen?"
Then we had Heather.
[Heather] So, shotgun wedding.
My mother and father didn't last very long.
translation.ko: 두 분은 얼마 못 가 헤어졌어요

translation.en: [Fred] I get a letter in the mail says I'm divorced,
and I have custody of this child.
I get custody of Heather.
Who would give custody to this damn drunken fool?
translation.ko: 나 같은 멍청한 주정뱅이한테 누가 양육권을 줘요?

translation.en: Custody of a three-year-old child, two-year-old child, whatever she was.
I mean, what the fuck is going on?
One day we were hanging out, drinking and partying,
this girl, Cindy, she liked what we were doing,
translation.ko: 신디라는 여자가 나타났어요 우리가 재밌어 보였겠죠

translation.en: getting high all the time, and she fit right in.
She'd need a place to stay and I said, "Hey, you could stay here."
translation.ko: 갈 곳이 없다길래 우리 집에 묵으라고 했죠

translation.en: "Help me watch my daughter." And she never left.
translation.ko: 딸 키우는 거 도와달라고 하니 눌러앉더라고요

translation.en: [Heather] There was some resentment there, because she was not my mother.
translation.ko: 적개심을 꽤 많이 보였죠 친모가 아니었잖아요

translation.en: I'm Fred's child, and she's having to care for me.
translation.ko: 프레드의 자식인 나를 돌보기까지 해야 하니

translation.en: It was very, very clear how much she hated me,
translation.ko: 날 얼마나 싫어하는지 아주 분명히 드러냈죠

translation.en: and she would let me know.
Tell me what a fucking failure I am.
Nobody wanted me.
Who would care about me?
"Your own mother doesn't want you. I don't want you."
translation.ko: '네 엄마도 널 버렸잖아 나도 네가 싫어'

translation.en: I mean, I'm going to fucking kindergarten.
If you've never been loved in your family,
if you've never been shown any kind of, like, warmth,
or this sincere affection just for you…
translation.ko: 나만을 위한 진실한 애정을 받지 못했는데

translation.en: and a man is finally gonna come and proclaim this love
translation.ko: 한 남자가 마침내 다가와서 사랑을 외치면서

translation.en: and all of these other wonderful things…
I would have just done anything. I really would have.
The tarot cards would reinforce these readings of extreme good luck,
translation.ko: 타로 카드로 최고의 대운이라는 해석이 확실하게 나왔죠 "행운, 풍성함, 부"

translation.en: success, wealth.
But I'm like, "How are we gonna do it?"
And that's where the sex magick starts coming into play.
[Solis on recording] The sighs and groans of an ecstatic woman…
[Heather] The highest achievement of sex is orgasm.
But after that release, it's done.
Where does this energy go?
It's just expended out into the ether.
So how do you harness this energy?
The end goal is to actually speak something into existence.
translation.ko: 최종 목표는 말로 내뱉어서 존재하게 하는 거예요

translation.en: [Solis] Freedom released in the psychic explosions of energy.
Abracadabra.
In our case, the goal was to make some money.
The money's dwindling,
We need jobs.
And he's like, "Why don't we get you a security job?"
translation.ko: 그가 그랬어요 '보안 관련 일을 하면 어때?' "0달러"

translation.en: So I applied for a position at Loomis.
[man] Whether by cash, check, or electronic transfer…
we're part of how you spend your money.
translation.ko: 우리는 여러분이 돈을 쓰는 방식의 일부입니다

translation.en: They asked if I had ever done a job like this before, and I said no.
translation.ko: 이런 일을 해본 적 있냐고 묻길래 없다고 했죠

translation.en: But they needed to hire a certain amount of females.
translation.ko: 하지만 여성 고용 할당량을 채워야 하더라고요

translation.en: Fuck, yeah. Click.
[man] Hey, Heather.
Hey, guys.
[Heather] I didn't know my way around Las Vegas.
Probably only had my license for a couple of months.
translation.ko: 면허를 딴 지도 몇 달 안 됐을 때였죠

translation.en: [man] She either was a naturally bad driver or had just learned how to drive.
translation.ko: 원래 운전을 더럽게 못하거나 배운 지 얼마 안 된 거죠

translation.en: -She used to two-pedal the… Remember that? -Two-pedal and…
translation.ko: - 페달 두 개를 동시에 - 그랬지 "스콧과 스티브 루미스 내 동료"

translation.en: And remember she hit me with the truck one time?
And couldn't… Yeah, she couldn't stop at stop lights, stop signs either.
translation.ko: 그래, 정지 신호에서 차를 세우질 못했지

translation.en: She got hired by our branch manager at the time
because she was young and she was pretty.
And I think he…
She just snowballed him. I really do.
[Scott] The ATM truck is a three-person team.
translation.ko: 현금 인출기 트럭은 3인조로 움직여요, 차량 기사에

translation.en: You have the driver and then you have the two employees in the back
translation.ko: 현금 인출기 트럭은 3인조로 움직여요, 차량 기사에 실제로 현금을 나르는 직원 2명이 뒤에 타죠

translation.en: that actually handle the money.
translation.ko: 실제로 현금을 나르는 직원 2명이 뒤에 타죠

translation.en: We serviced ATM machines on the… all the casinos,
translation.ko: 저희가 담당한 건 모든 카지노의 현금 인출기와

translation.en: and Bank of America machines.
Ah, we'd go in, remove all the cash that was in the machines,
translation.ko: 들어가서 인출기에 있는 현금을 다 빼고

translation.en: and replace it with brand new cash.
[Heather] There was in excess of, like, four or five million on certain days.
I would tell Solis,
"You should see all the money in the back of it."
translation.ko: '차에 돈이 얼마나 많이 실리는지 보여 줘야 하는데'

translation.en: We're laying in bed discussing things.
He used to ask me how was my day.
"Oh, God, I don't know."
"Monday, we got to go to the west. Tuesday, this."
"What days, you think, are the more… like, the heavier days?"
translation.ko: '보통, 어느 날에 현금이 더 많은 것 같아?'

translation.en: And over time, I could see that I was telling him what he needed.
translation.ko: 시간이 지나면서 솔리스에게 정보를 주고 있다는 걸 깨달았죠

translation.en: And it becomes a plan slowly.
And then he said, "Could I write down the routes?"
And he would take my notes and follow…
translation.ko: "월요일 오전 8시 30분, 루미스 출발" 솔리스는 제 메모를 받아 따라다니며

translation.en: so that he could see what that Monday route looked like.
What did that Tuesday route look like?
What did that Wednesday route look like?
Go at different times of the day, go at different times of the week.
translation.ko: 하루 중 여러 시간대와 한 주의 여러 요일도 살폈죠

translation.en: See what's going on with the environments and surroundings.
translation.ko: 환경과 상황에 따라 뭐가 달라지는지도 보고요

translation.en: What was it like at nine o'clock in the morning, what was it like at ten?
What kind of activities are going on? Where are the security guards?
translation.ko: '무슨 활동을 하는 거야? 경비는 어디 있지?'

translation.en: Obviously, I told him which day was my heaviest day,
translation.ko: 어느 날 현금 수송이 가장 많은지 로버토한테 말해 줬죠

translation.en: and the beginnings of this heist is starting to come into formation.
translation.ko: 그러면서 이 강도 사건이 서서히 형태를 갖추기 시작했어요

translation.en: We're gonna take this truck full of money.
Circus Circus was the first service point straight out from the yard.
translation.ko: 회사에서 나오자마자 가장 먼저 들르는 곳이 '서커스 서커스'였죠

translation.en: And they only took what they were using to service those machines,
translation.ko: 직원 둘은 거기 인출기에 채울 돈만 가져갔으니

translation.en: so the majority of the money was still with me.
translation.ko: 남은 현금 대부분은 여전히 차에 저와 있었어요

translation.en: [Scott] It was the only location that we would have to be dropped off at one spot
translation.ko: 그 지점에서만 유일하게 저희가 한 곳에서 내린 뒤

translation.en: and picked up on a completely different area.
From where we get dropped off to where we get picked up,
translation.ko: "지하층 입구, 승차 지점" 하차 지점부터 재승차 지점 사이에

translation.en: we have six or eight ATM machines, and they're in various locations of the building.
translation.ko: 현금 인출기가 건물 곳곳에 6~8대 정도 있었죠

translation.en: [Heather] They're in there for a really long time on that day.
I expressed that to Solis.
"This is what I'm seeing, and these guys take forever in there."
translation.ko: '이 사람들, 거기 한 번 들어가면 나오지를 않아'

translation.en: And he's like, "That's where this will happen."
Because they're gone for a long time, they won't recognize
translation.ko: 오랫동안 자리를 비우느라 제가 사라졌다는 사실을

translation.en: or be alerted to the fact that I'm missing.
Maybe they'll think I forgot to go to the other entrance.
translation.ko: 다른 쪽으로 오는 걸 깜박한 걸로 생각하겠죠

translation.en: [Steve] She couldn't remember the route week by week.
translation.ko: 매주 달라지는 경로를 기억 못 하더라고요

translation.en: We'd come in and go out the same doors.
And… [chuckles] …she'd forget,
translation.ko: 깜박하고는 다른 곳에 가 있곤 했죠

translation.en: and she'd move around to some other place and then we'd have to go locate her.
translation.ko: 깜박하고는 다른 곳에 가 있곤 했죠 그러면 우리가 찾아야 했어요

translation.en: She could never remember exactly how to get to a machine or where to park.
translation.ko: 인출기까지 오는 길이나 주차장을 매번 기억 못 했어요

translation.en: And then he rented the garage, which was a ploy,
translation.ko: 그러다 솔리스가 차고를 빌렸죠 그것도 계략이었어요

translation.en: and he had put a banner on the outside of it,
as if we're gonna do something for your vehicle.
This is where things started becoming more solidified.
translation.ko: "자동차 강판 보강 서비스" 여기서 일이 점점 더 구체화되기 시작했어요

translation.en: It was determined that on a Friday, when they left to go in there,
translation.ko: 금요일에 직원들이 들어갔을 때 하기로 했죠

translation.en: that would be the opportune time.
Because they only took a few bags each to do their ATM stock.
translation.ko: 현금 인출기를 채울 가방 몇 개만 가져가거든요

translation.en: And then I would drive to that garage.
translation.ko: 그때 제가 차고로 가면 되는 거였어요

translation.en: There was a neighbor next door. And he tried to engage us in conversation one time.
translation.ko: 옆집의 이웃은 우리한테 자꾸 말을 걸려고 했죠

translation.en: And I'm like, "Oh, hey! Hi, hello."
And he's like, "So, what do you guys… What kind of business is this?"
And I'm like, "Yeah, you know, it's, like, an armored car repair service."
And then Solis would be like, "Stop fucking talking to people."
translation.ko: 솔리스는 이랬어요 '얘기 좀 작작해, 뭔 짓이야?'

translation.en: "The fuck you doing? This person can identify you."
translation.ko: 솔리스는 이랬어요 '얘기 좀 작작해, 뭔 짓이야?' '저자가 널 알아볼지도 몰라'

translation.en: The man was not a stupid criminal.
Okay. I'm in deeper than I probably can manage.
translation.ko: 네, 감당할 수 있는 수준보다 더 깊이 빠져들었어요

translation.en: I think he could sense some little trepidation inside of me.
translation.ko: 솔리스도 내 안에 있는 약간의 공포를 느꼈을 거예요

translation.en: Life moved very quickly for me and it was like a blur.
translation.ko: 삶이 너무 빠르게 움직여서 흐릿할 정도였어요

translation.en: As things went on,
I knew I was not gonna be well received if I expressed to him how…
translation.ko: 내가 생각을 드러내면 솔리스가 좋아하지 않을 거란 걸 알았죠 "강도 사건 2주 전"

translation.en: "I don't know about this. I'm scared."
[Solis, softly] Stay focused.
[Heather] He would play these self-hypnotizing tapes
translation.ko: 자기 최면 테이프를 틀어서 내 자신감을 북돋곤 했죠

translation.en: to help build my confidence, calm my nerves.
translation.ko: 자기 최면 테이프를 틀어서 내 자신감을 북돋곤 했죠 신경도 안정시키고요

translation.en: In a way, I didn't think it was really gonna ever happen.
translation.ko: 어떤 면에서는 그 일이 정말 일어날지 몰랐어요

translation.en: I decided not to address those feelings and those fears.
translation.ko: 그런 감정과 두려움을 파헤치지 않기로 했죠

translation.en: They had to go away, to disappear.
Do you think I'm gonna be like, "Oh, no, honey."
"As much as this sounds great, I think I'm gonna bow out now."
Saying no to him was not an option.
translation.ko: 그의 말을 거절하는 건 있을 수 없었어요

translation.en: This is a man who lived a very violent life.
[newswoman] Today, a murderer was paroled from a life sentence
translation.ko: 오늘 종신형으로 복역하던 한 살인자가 가석방되었습니다

translation.en: because of his poetry. A so-called "prison poet."
Let me go with my chest raised high…
[newswoman] Roberto Solis, also known as Pancho Aguila,
translation.ko: 일명 판초 아구일라로 통하는 로버토 솔리스는 "판초 아구일라의 시"

translation.en: was sentenced to life in prison for the brutal murder
of Loomis armored car guard Louis Dake during a botched robbery in 1969.
translation.ko: 1969년에 루미스의 현금 수송차 경비 루이스 데이크를 죽였습니다

translation.en: While serving at Folsom Prison, Solis wrote five books of poetry
translation.ko: 폴섬 교도소에서 복역하는 동안 5권의 시집을 낸 솔리스는 "억류된 목소리"

translation.en: and has won wide acclaim.
It was a recent letter-writing campaign
involving several prominent poets and publishers
translation.ko: 최근에 가석방 위원회에 편지를 보내 설득했다고 합니다

translation.en: that convinced the parole board.
translation.ko: 최근에 가석방 위원회에 편지를 보내 설득했다고 합니다 "100% 미국인이며"

translation.en: And so today, he finds himself free
translation.ko: "제자 없는 간디 같은 사람입니다" 그래서 오늘 솔리스는

translation.en: after serving only 23 years of that life sentence.
[Solis, echoing] After 16 years of imprisonment,
all the rosy-colored eyeglasses have been shattered…
translation.ko: 눈에 씌워져 있던 장밋빛 선글라스는 박살이 나고

translation.en: …to be replaced by a clear vision of history and human nature.
translation.ko: 역사와 인간의 본성을 좀 더 분명히 보게 되었습니다

translation.en: [Heather] Solis felt he deserved this
because of what the Loomis robbery had taken from him.
translation.ko: 잃은 게 많으니 이럴 권리가 있다고 생각했어요

translation.en: The years Loomis had taken.
So, he was gonna get back, somehow.
You're dealing with an individual that's capable of cold-blooded murder,
translation.ko: 상대는 냉혹한 살인을 저지를 수 있는 사람이었어요

translation.en: but I didn't focus on that at the time.
"You deserve to get back what they took from you."
translation.ko: '그 사람들이 자기한테서 뺏어 간 걸 되찾아야지'

translation.en: "We deserve this. This is our destiny."
You convince yourself
that what you're doing is the right thing to do.
translation.ko: 지금 하는 게 옳은 일이라고 믿게 만들어요

translation.en: Because you love that person.
I loved him unconditionally, without a doubt,
translation.ko: 한 점의 의심도 없이 무조건적으로 사랑했죠

translation.en: and I was gonna be there with him regardless of what your subconscious says.
translation.ko: 그래서 무의식이 뭐라고 하든 그와 함께할 작정이었어요

translation.en: We weren't taking from Joe Schmo, who's a blue-collar worker,
translation.ko: 우리가 돈을 훔치는 상대는 제조업에 종사하는 노동자도

translation.en: or someone like my old man that punched a clock.
translation.ko: 우리 아빠처럼 시급으로 돈 받는 사람도 아니었죠

translation.en: We weren't hurting somebody that was working hard,
translation.ko: 우리가 피해를 끼치는 상대는 열심히 일하면서

translation.en: just trying to provide for their family.
We were taking from a conglomerate.
I was right there with him. I wasn't gonna let him down.
translation.ko: 전 솔리스 곁에 있었죠 실망시키고 싶지 않았어요

translation.en: To be honest, I wanted it too.
I wanted some opulent shit in my life. I wanted material wealth.
translation.ko: 엄청나게 호화롭게 살고 싶었죠 물질적 부를 원했어요

translation.en: We had all these grand ideas, like what to do with the money.
translation.ko: 돈을 어떻게 쓸지를 놓고 멋진 생각도 많이 나눴죠

translation.en: We'll live on a farm, we'll have goats, we'll have chickens,
translation.ko: 농장에서 살면서 염소와 닭을 키우는 거예요

translation.en: we'll be self-sufficient, we'll have solar power.
We wanted utopia.
We knew once I was driving away, we'd have less than an hour
translation.ko: 일단 차를 몰고 도망치면 여유는 1시간도 채 안 돼요

translation.en: before every cop in Vegas was looking for me.
translation.ko: 라스베이거스의 모든 경찰이 날 찾을 테니까요

translation.en: The question was how to move millions in cash without anybody noticing?
translation.ko: 누구의 눈에도 안 띄고 수백만 달러를 옮기는 게 문제였죠

translation.en: He took control of that situation, I just went along with it.
In the meantime, we had to figure out what to do with me.
translation.ko: 한편, 날 어떻게 할지도 생각해야 했어요

translation.en: How to get from garage point to this airplane and beyond
translation.ko: 차고 지점에서 비행기가 있는 곳까지 가면서

translation.en: without looking like the girl that's probably gonna be on the news later that night.
translation.ko: 그날 밤에 뉴스에 나올 여자처럼 보이지 않아야 했죠

translation.en: What do we do to make myself look the most different?
translation.ko: 어떻게 하면 내가 가장 달라 보일까?

translation.en: And I was like, "I could get a blonde wig."
And he was like, "No, no, no, you just… You're not… You're not getting this."
translation.ko: 그 사람이 그러더군요 '안 돼, 이해를 못 하는구나'

translation.en: "We're getting you a gray wig and you're gonna be old."
So, gray wig, bogus glasses,
translation.ko: 그래서 흰머리 가발과 가짜 안경을 준비했어요

translation.en: and I'm like, "Oh… Ohh!"
"Clever."
How you build up a robbery is by taking time and observing.
translation.ko: 강도를 제대로 하려면 시간을 들여 관찰해야 해요

translation.en: And let's reinforce it now with this practice of sex magick.
translation.ko: 이제 섹스 마법을 부려서 강도가 잘되게 할 차례였죠

translation.en: This is all the energy that we've expended.
We're tapping into this resource, and it's gonna come back.
translation.ko: 이 자원을 활용하면 도움이 될 거였어요

translation.en: And he was like, "We gotta do a couple test runs,
make sure you're confident, you're smooth,
you're not making any mistakes, you're not making any wrong turns."
translation.ko: '실수를 저지르거나 길을 잘못 들거나 하면 안 되니까'

translation.en: Go through the motions, go through the motions,
what it would feel like.
The universe is abundant, and we're part of the universe.
So why can't we have some of the abundance?
translation.ko: 그러니 그 풍요로움을 좀 가져도 되잖아요?

translation.en: I am the vessel for this magick to be turned into reality.
translation.ko: 전 이 마법을 현실로 바꿀 사람이었어요

translation.en: This was our purpose.
Kismet.
We deserve this.
This was our destiny.
Eight o'clock in the morning, sun's coming up.
I wasn't crying, I wasn't nervous.
I wasn't trying to be weird. I just go over the plan.
translation.ko: 이상하게 굴려고 하지 않았어요 그냥 계획만 점검하죠

translation.en: This is step one, step two, step three,
step four.
Doing, uh, the tape one last time.
He had all the costume stuff ready to go, and he was really focused.
translation.ko: 로버토는 변장용품을 다 챙겼고 매우 집중한 상태였어요

translation.en: All the adrenaline's coursing through your veins,
and you're like, "Oh, my gosh."
You know, like, "Hey, this is really going down."
[Scott] She wore a dressier shoe that day.
It wasn't like a work boot that she'd normally wear.
"That ain't right." I actually went to our operations manager and said,
translation.ko: 그건 옳지 않았어요 작업반장한테 가서 말했죠 '저건 아니잖아요'

translation.en: "That ain't right."
And he told me to not worry about it, just get on the road.
[Steve] We had an area that we were supposed to park in at Circus Circus.
translation.ko: 서커스 서커스에 주차하기로 된 곳이 있었어요

translation.en: When we left, we took all the money for all the ATM machines.
translation.ko: 출발하면서 인출기에 채울 돈을 다 가져갔죠

translation.en: Probably about a million. A million and change.
But it was enough to get those ATMs filled for a weekend.
translation.ko: 인출기를 주말 동안 채우기에 충분한 돈이었죠

translation.en: [Heather] They no longer existed.
Everything to the left of me did not exist.
translation.ko: 과거의 내 모든 모습은 존재하지 않았어요

translation.en: I was going right.
[Steve] From the time she dropped us off to the time we walked out,
translation.ko: 우릴 내려줬을 때부터 우리가 밖으로 나왔을 때까진

translation.en: everything was normal. It's once we walked out,
translation.ko: 모든 게 정상이었어요 밖으로 나왔을 때

translation.en: that's when it became abnormal.
[Scott] It was like, "Okay, where's she at?"
First thing in my mind wasn't like, "Oh, God, she got into an accident." You know?
translation.ko: 제일 먼저 떠오른 건 '사고가 났나 보다'가 아니었어요

translation.en: The first thing in my mind was, "She got lost."
translation.ko: 이런 생각이 먼저 떠올랐죠 '길을 잃었나 보군'

translation.en: -[laughs] "She got lost." -Yeah. Basically. And then we're like,
"Oh, man, I bet she's still back there where she dropped us off at."
[Scott] So then we backtrack to the drop-off point.
Your brain starts racing because you're in a potential worst-case scenario
translation.ko: 머리가 빙빙 돌기 시작해요 이 일을 하면서 생길 수 있는

translation.en: with the job that you're supposed to be doing.
Your vehicle that is your safe haven is gone.
I said, "I think the bitch took the truck."
translation.ko: 전 그랬죠 '그년이 트럭 갖고 도망갔나 봐'

translation.en: Anybody seeing us walking out with no truck there, they just could've said,
translation.ko: 차도 없이 나온 우리를 봤다면 누구든 그랬을 거예요

translation.en: -"Hey, look at these guys." -Yeah.
translation.ko: '저 녀석들 보게 큰 캔버스 가방을 들고 있잖아'

translation.en: "Walking around with that big canvas bag. I bet there's money in it."
translation.ko: '저 녀석들 보게 큰 캔버스 가방을 들고 있잖아' '분명 돈이 있을 거야'

translation.en: I'd never been left, like, stranded like that.
translation.ko: 그렇게 오도 가도 못한 적은 처음이었죠

translation.en: If I would've saw her within the next 20 minutes,
translation.ko: 그 뒤 20분 안에 그 여자를 다시 만났다면

translation.en: -I probably would've shot her myself. -[both laughing]
[man] I'm a street cop on the Strip in Las Vegas.
translation.ko: 전 라스베이거스 스트립 지역을 순찰하는 경찰이에요

translation.en: We get the call
when people are still crying and sweating and blood is still rolling.
translation.ko: "에드 로넌, 형사" 사람들이 아직 울부짖고 땀 흘리며 피가 뚝뚝 떨어질 때죠

translation.en: Go, go, go. You clear one call, you get another one almost immediately.
translation.ko: 출동해서 한 건을 마무리하면 바로 다음 신고가 들어와요

translation.en: It's one of the only jobs that you can have where you get to drive fast and mess with people.
translation.ko: 과속하고 사람들과 싸워도 되는 유일한 직업일 겁니다

translation.en: This particular day, something had happened at Circus Circus.
translation.ko: "강도 사건 1시간 뒤" 그날은 서커스 서커스에서 무슨 일이 터졌어요

translation.en: [dispatcher] Four-zero-seven, four-zero-seven, robbery reported at 2880 South Las Vegas Boulevard,
Circus Circus Casino.
[Ed] And while I'm en route to the scene, I'm looking for an armored truck.
translation.ko: 그래서 현장으로 출동하면서 눈은 현금 수송차를 찾았어요

translation.en: 'Cause I don't know what we have, but I'm looking for that armored truck on the way.
translation.ko: 사건을 정확히는 몰라도 가는 길에 계속 그 차를 찾았죠

translation.en: [Heather] He becomes Dr. Jekyll-Mr. Hyde,
'cause he's now in this take-charge, "This is what we're doing,
translation.ko: 갑자기 보스처럼 굴며 말했어요 '내 말 잘 들어 정신줄 잡고 염병할 총 내놔'

translation.en: you need to just get a grip, take your fucking gun off."
translation.ko: '내 말 잘 들어 정신줄 잡고 염병할 총 내놔'

translation.en: And he gets my weapon.
Hurry the fuck up!
[Heather] I'm just butt naked in a fucking garage with a man with my gun.
translation.ko: 좆 같은 차고에서 홀랑 벗은 채 총도 남자한테 뺏겼죠

translation.en: That moment of no return is standing there with your britches down,
translation.ko: 이미 뒤로 물러설 수 없는 단계에 거기 서서 바지를 벗고

translation.en: trying to put on a costume,
meanwhile a man convicted of murder is in possession of three million dollars
translation.ko: 그러는 동안 살인 전과범은 손에 300만 달러와

translation.en: and a loaded firearm.
In a fucking closed garage.
That moment of fear hits you, and you're like, "Fuck!"
translation.ko: 공포의 순간이 강타하면서 이런 생각이 들어요, '썅'

translation.en: I started taking witness statements from the two guards that were there,
translation.ko: 현장에 있었던 두 경호원들에게 목격자 진술서를 받고

translation.en: and initiated a crime report from Loomis.
[Scott] I remember it was the FBI, Las Vegas Metro,
they had questions. And I don't know, who else?
[Steve] I talked to Chief of Security at Circus Circus.
They brought in our Security Vice President…
-Yeah. -…from Houston at the time.
Everybody was involved.
[Ed] I got information
Heather Tallchief had only been working for Loomis for a couple of weeks.
translation.ko: 헤더 톨치프가 루미스에서 일한 건 고작 몇 주에 불과했어요

translation.en: She's sitting alone in the armored truck
with a couple of million dollars in cash, unsupervised.
translation.ko: 몇백만 달러의 현금이 감독관도 없이 실려 있었죠

translation.en: I started thinking this could be a kidnap or a hostage situation.
translation.ko: 납치나 인질 사건일 수도 있겠다고 생각하기 시작했어요

translation.en: The sanctity of life turns it into a whole new deal.
translation.ko: 목숨의 신성함 때문에 완전히 새로운 사건이 돼요

translation.en: The larceny was no longer foremost in my mind.
I was trying to find the armored car so that I could find Heather.
translation.ko: 현금 수송차를 찾는 건 헤더를 찾기 위해서였어요

translation.en: I got a copy of the route they were supposed to go, just to make sure the car wasn't there.
translation.ko: 원래 근무 경로를 따라가면서 차량이 없는지 확인했죠

translation.en: Every police car in the city are looking for this car.
translation.ko: 시의 모든 경찰차가 이 차를 찾아요

translation.en: [Heather] Okay. I'm still here.
[Solis] Come on!
[Heather] We start loading the money up.
And then these other fears started coming in,
because now we have to get into mode to escape.
Police are looking for you, you don't have time to think,
translation.ko: 경찰은 날 찾고 있고 생각할 시간 따위는 없죠

translation.en: and so this different type of thing hits.
You know, a different type of adrenaline.
And after that moment, or that thing where…
Like when you almost get into a car accident but you don't,
translation.ko: 차를 몰고 가다가 사고가 날뻔할 때 있잖아요

translation.en: and you're like, "Whew! That was fucking close, man."
It was, like, fast, fast, fast.
I don't remember conversating. It was work time.
translation.ko: 대화를 나눈 기억도 없어요 일만 했죠

translation.en: The boxes were quite big, and they were heavy as fuck.
So, you got stacks of hundreds, stacks of twenties, stacks of fifties,
and they're vacuum sealed so they're, like, perfect bricks.
This stuff is happening in seconds, second, seconds, seconds, seconds.
Boxes in the vehicle, garage door opens, we go out.
translation.ko: 차에 상자를 싣고 차고 문을 연 뒤 나가요

translation.en: I'm down in the well of the car.
And then he parked so he could mail the boxes.
translation.ko: 로버토는 주차를 한 뒤 상자를 부치러 가요

translation.en: We can't take it on a plane.
So, we mailed it.
Meanwhile, I'm trying to put these contacts in…
Oh, my God. [laughing]
I can't get these motherfuckers in my eyes.
"Oh, my God, you're cracking up."
[chuckling] This is the moment where you lose your mind.
Solis comes back.
"Okay, stay down!"
I'm staying down.
And he said, "You know what those are? They're looking for you."
translation.ko: 그 사람이 말해요 '저 소리 들려? 널 찾는 소리야'

translation.en: I did not know while I was in the wheel well of that car,
translation.ko: 그 차 조수석 앞에 웅크리고 있는 저는 몰랐지만

translation.en: but my life as a fugitive began
with the fluttering of those fucking helicopters
above my head.
